entries.meaning: A cord or wire arranged so that when snagged or pulled by an intruder, it will trigger a detector or trap or a device, such as a land mine.
examples: Seeing the tripwire of a nearby bouncing Betty gave us cold chills, and we moved all the more slowly through the woods.

entries.meaning: Any means of detecting intruders or attackers.
examples: The continued presence of U.S. troops as a tripwire force in Macedonia is an increasingly risky venture.

verbs.description: tripwire (third-person singular simple present tripwires, present participle tripwiring, simple past and past participle tripwired)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To set a tripwire mechanism in (a location).
